meanings.definition: The edge or margin of a steep place or of land bordering water.
meanings.sent1: She stood at the brink of the cliff, feeling the wind on her face.
meanings.sent2: The river flowed peacefully along the brink of the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel teetered on the brink of the bird feeder, trying to steal some seeds.
meanings.sent4: His reckless behavior brought him to the brink of disaster.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge was crumbling at the brink, a sign of its age.

meanings.definition: The point at which something is likely to begin.
meanings.sent1: The team was at the brink of victory, needing just one more goal to win.
meanings.sent2: The brink of a new adventure always filled her with excitement.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about being at the brink of starting a new diet every Monday.
meanings.sent4: The discovery of the ancient artifact marked the brink of a new era in archaeology.
meanings.sent5: As the clock struck midnight, they were at the brink of a brand new year.
